US says to investigate national security data risks from Chinese vehiclesThe White House said on Thursday the United States is opening an investigation into whether Chinese vehicle imports pose national security risks and could impose restrictions due to concerns about "connected" car technology. Finnish businessman Zilliacus pulls out of Inter Milan raceFinnish businessman Thomas Zilliacus said on Thursday he had dropped out of the running to buy Inter Milan to focus on clearing his name after police in Singapore issued a warrant for his arrest last week. Japanese investors allocate more to overseas equities than homeJapanese investors are hesitant to own their home stock markets despite the Nikkei's recent surge above bubble-era peaks because of uncertainty about sustained corporate returns and lingering memories of the 1990s market crash. Thu, 29 Feb 2024 09:47:13 GMT VNUV5656NRMSJPYUVGBB3LOK4Y https://www.reuters.com/markets/asia/japanese-investors-allocate-more-overseas-equities-than-home-2024-02-29/Reuters市场亚洲市场
China slams foreign criticism of upcoming Hong Kong's Article 23 national security lawChina on Thursday criticised British Foreign Secretary David Cameron and other foreign politicians for "smearing" an upcoming Hong Kong security law, as local authorities said feedback on the law had been largely positive. Thu, 29 Feb 2024 08:05:25 GMT TYXRJHV75ZPZ5AWBL7AEPGLIVI https://www.reuters.com/world/china/china-slams-foreign-criticism-upcoming-hong-kongs-article-23-national-security-2024-02-29/Jessie Pang, James Pomfret世界中国
Chinese firms step up hiring, but tight-fisted on payChinese university graduate Zhang Baichuan travels hundreds of kilometres from one job fair to another in a final push to find a better offer than the unappealing one he received after more than 1,000 applications. Sensodyne-maker Haleon jumps on share buyback, falling debtHaleon plans to buy back 500 million pounds ($633 million) of its shares this year amid firm demand for its products and progress in reducing debt, sending the British consumer healthcare giant's shares up over 8% on Thursday. Exclusive: SpaceX's talks with Vietnam over Starlink on holdSpaceX's plans to provide communications services to Vietnam with its Starlink satellites have been put on hold, three sources familiar with the matter said, halting support for Vietnamese coast guard drones. 'No role' for China in Pacific policing, Australian minister saysAustralia's Pacific Minister Pat Conroy said there should be "no role" for China in policing the Pacific Islands, and Australia will train more local security forces to fill gaps, after Reuters reported Chinese police are working in Kiribati. Thu, 29 Feb 2024 06:09:28 GMT CDE6SENRFVLW7DLNE7LW3RRSCE https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/no-role-china-pacific-policing-australian-minister-says-2024-02-29/Kirsty Needham世界亚太地区
China's Feb factory activity likely contracted for fifth monthChina's manufacturing activity likely contracted for a fifth straight month in February, a Reuters poll showed on Thursday, possibly increasing the clamour for further stimulus measures as factory owners struggle for orders both at home and abroad.
